meanings.definition: The act of engaging in a physical fight for a reward or prize.
meanings.sent1: In the old days, prizefightings were common among knights for honor.
meanings.sent2: The town hosted prizefightings every summer to entertain the locals.
meanings.sent3: The prizefightings at the fair were so intense, even the chickens were watching!
meanings.sent4: Her determination in the prizefightings was like a lion defending its territory.
meanings.sent5: The sound of the bell marked the beginning of the prizefightings, echoing through the arena.

meanings.definition: The sport or activity of participating in organized fighting matches for a monetary reward.
meanings.sent1: Fans eagerly awaited the prizefightings to see who would emerge victorious.
meanings.sent2: He trained hard to excel in the world of prizefightings and earn his living.
meanings.sent3: The prizefightings were so popular that even the mayor wanted a front-row seat.
meanings.sent4: Her dedication to the prizefightings was like a marathon runner pushing through the pain.
meanings.sent5: The atmosphere in the arena crackled with excitement during the prizefightings.

meanings.definition: The practice of competing in boxing matches for a championship title or monetary prize.
meanings.sent1: His dream was to win the championship in the world of prizefightings.
meanings.sent2: The gym was filled with aspiring boxers training for their prizefightings.
meanings.sent3: The prizefightings were so intense that even the referees were sweating.
meanings.sent4: Her strategy in the prizefightings was like a chess player planning their moves.
meanings.sent5: The crowd erupted in cheers as the champion entered the ring for the prizefightings.
